title: صِيَغ المُبَالَغَة
description: Learn about صِيَغ المُبَالَغَة, special noun patterns in Arabic that express intensity, frequency, or habitual action, including the five main patterns: فَعَّال، فَعُول، فَعِيل، مِفْعَال، فَعِل.

notes.title: Introduction to Intensive Forms
content: صِيَغ المُبَالَغَة (intensive forms) are special noun patterns derived from verbs that express intensity, abundance, or frequency of an action or quality.
While اسم الفاعل (active participle) indicates simply that someone does an action, صِيَغ المُبَالَغَة indicate that someone does it frequently, intensely, or as a defining characteristic.
For example, كَاتِب means 'one who writes' (writer), but كَتَّاب means 'one who writes abundantly' (prolific writer). These forms are extensively used in the Quran to describe Allah's attributes.
keyPoints: Derived from verbs, like اسم الفاعل
Express intensity, frequency, or habitual action
Commonly used for Allah's names and attributes

examples.english: Allah is Most Appreciative (شَكُور from شَكَرَ)
He is a very patient man

notes.title: The Pattern فَعَّال
content: The pattern فَعَّال is one of the most common intensive forms. It is formed by doubling the middle letter (عَيْن الفِعْل) and adding alif after it.
This pattern indicates someone who does an action frequently, abundantly, or professionally. It can also indicate occupation or profession.
Many of Allah's Beautiful Names (الأسماء الحسنى) follow this pattern, emphasizing His abundant and continuous actions.
keyPoints: Common in Allah's names: غَفَّار، قَهَّار، وَهَّاب

examples.english: Very patient (from صَبَرَ - to be patient)

notes.title: The Patterns فَعُول and فَعِيل
content: فَعُول indicates someone who does an action intensely or as a characteristic quality. It emphasizes inherent nature or continuous state.
فَعِيل also indicates intensity and is very common in classical Arabic. It often describes permanent qualities or deep-rooted characteristics.
Both patterns are frequently used in the Quran for Allah's attributes, showing His perfect and complete qualities.
keyPoints: Very common in Quranic descriptions of Allah

notes.title: The Patterns مِفْعَال and فَعِل
content: مِفْعَال indicates someone who habitually or characteristically does an action. The initial مِ is a distinctive feature of this pattern.
فَعِل is the least common of the five patterns. It indicates someone possessing a quality as an innate characteristic, often related to caution or natural disposition.
These two patterns, while less frequent than the others, appear in classical texts and are important for comprehensive understanding of Arabic morphology.
